localizedDescriptions.en: A persistent and managed list of any combination of archetypes that will support the accurate recording of a Care plan.
Plan or sequence of discrete activities developed to achieve a specified management goal or treatment outcome, carried out by health professionals and/or the patient.
Name of care plan.
Anticipated date beyond which the care plan can be deemed 'expired'.
Care team details aligned with FHIR resource.
Identifies what kind of team. This is to support differentiation between multiple co-existing teams, such as care plan team, episode of care team, longitudinal care team.
The care team category is condition.
A label for human use intended to distinguish like teams.

annotations.comment: E.g. the "red" vs. "green" trauma teams.

localizedDescriptions.en: Identifies all people and organizations who are expected to be involved in the care team.
Indicates specific responsibility of an individual within the care team, such as "Primary care physician", "Trained social worker counselor", "Caregiver", etc.
Practitioner details aligned with FHIR resource.
Identifier details aligned with FHIR resources or data types.
The identifier value.
The purpose of the identifier.
The usual identifier.
The official identifier.
A temporary identifier.
A secondary identifier.
Name details aligned with FHIR resource.
Identification of the purpose for the name.
The usual name.
A text representation of the full name.
FHIR telecom details.
Telecommunications form for contact point - what communications system is required to make use of the contact.
The communication form is phone.
The communication form is fax.
The communication form is email.
The communication form is URL.
The communication form is pager.
The communication is SMS.
The communication form is other.
The actual contact point details, in a form that is meaningful to the designated communication system (i.e. phone number or email address).
An order for a medication, vaccine, nutritional product or other therapeutic item for an identified individual.
Details of the requested order.
Name of the medication, vaccine or other therapeutic/prescribable item being ordered.

annotations.comment: Depending on the prescribing context this field could be used for either generic- or product-based prescribing. This data field can be used to record tightly bound orders of different medications when they are prescribed as a single pack. It is strongly recommended that the 'Medication item' be coded with a terminology capable of triggering decision support, where possible. The extent of coding may vary from the simple name of the medication item through to structured details about the actual medication pack to be used. Free text entry should only be used if there is no appropriate terminology available.

localizedDescriptions.en: The route by which the ordered item is to be administered into the subject's body.

annotations.comment:
For example: 'oral', 'intravenous', or 'topical'.
Coding of the route with a terminology is preferred, where possible. Multiple potential routes may be specified.

localizedDescriptions.en: An additional instruction directed primarily at the individual/patient or carers.

annotations.comment: For example: 'To reduce your blood pressure', 'To thin your blood'. This data element allows multiple occurrences and should be coded with a reference terminology, where possible. If required it is possible to use a LINK attribute to associate this element with, for example, the 'original diagnosis' in a separate Problem list composition but the indication should be explicitly recorded here, as the link target may change over time.

localizedDescriptions.en: The clinical reason for use of the ordered item.

annotations.comment: For example: 'Angina'. Coding of the clinical indication with a terminology is preferred, where possible. This data element allows multiple occurrences. It is not intended to carry an indication for administrative authorisation purposes.

localizedDescriptions.en: Additional narrative about the medication order not captured in other fields.
Structured details of a single therapeutic direction for an ordered item, such as a medication or blood transfusion order.
The intended position of this direction within the overall sequence of directions.

annotations.comment:
For example: ''1' '2', '3'.
Where multiple dosage directions are expressed, the 'Direction sequence' makes the order in which they should be executed explicit. For example: (1) 1 tab daily for 3 days, (2) 1 tab twice daily for 4 days, (3) 1 tablet for 7 days.

localizedDescriptions.en: The length of time for which this direction should be applied.

annotations.comment: For example: 'for 7 days','Indefinite'. An example of a set of multiple directions, with varying durations might be ... '1 tablet daily for 3 days, 2 tablets daily for 4 days, then 3 tablets Indefinite'.

localizedDescriptions.en: The length of time for which this direction should be applied.
The direction should be continued indefinitely.
The direction should be continued indefinitely with a strong recommendation that it never be discontinued.
The length of time for which this direction should be applied.
The length of time for which this direction should be applied.
The combination of a medication amount and administration timing for a single day, in the context of a medication order or medication management.

annotations.comment: For example: '2 tablets at 6pm' or '20mg three times per day'. Please note: this cluster allows multiple occurrences to enable representation of a complete set of dose patterns for a single dose direction.

localizedDescriptions.en: The value of the amount of medication administered at one time, as a real number, or range of real numbers, and associated with the Dose unit.
The value of the amount of medication administered at one time, as a real number, or range of real numbers, and associated with the Dose unit.
The value of the amount of medication administered at one time, as a real number, or range of real numbers, and associated with the Dose unit.
The unit which is associated with the Dose amount.

annotations.comment: For example: 'tablet','mg'. Coding of the dose unit with a terminology is preferred, where possible.

localizedDescriptions.en: Structured information about the intended timing of a therapeutic or diagnostic activity within any 24 hour period.
The frequency as number of times per time period that the activity is to take place.

annotations.comment: For example: "4 times per day" or "3 to 4 times per hour".

localizedDescriptions.en: The frequency as number of times per time period that the activity is to take place.
The frequency as number of times per time period that the activity is to take place.
